16ce71b3-40ef-496c-9e4d-d8429e5a85b1.description: The Q-Audit End user training is accomplished by completing labs focused on insider threat identification using Q-Audit and its near real-time analytics capabilities, as well as attending Q-Audit end user training.
16ce71b3-40ef-496c-9e4d-d8429e5a85b1.name: Certified Q-Audit End User

badge_template_activities.title: The Q-Audit End User Training is a half-day course that introduces students to the ICS 500-27 standard that is the foundation for the Q-Audit application, walks through all the features and functionality of the dashboards in Q-Audit, and explains how they support the auditing requirements of the standard. The course ends with multiple hands-on lab exercises that demonstrate how users can use the audit and investigative capabilities of Q-Audit.

Successfully completing 12 in-depth labs in the course, demonstrating competence in: 1) demonstrating compliance with ICS 500-27 on a classified information system boundary, 2) tracking down an insider threat based on abnormal user behavior, 2) tracking down an insider threat based on abnormal host machine behavior, and 4) tracking down an insider threat based on risk assessment and scoring.

dbea7cf4-b0fa-4443-a34d-8d0c0909eb10.description: The badge recipient has attended the Q-Compliance End User course and successfully completed all labs, demonstrating understanding and the ability to use Q-Compliance for Information system risk assessment, auditing, and adhering to the risk management framework (RMF). The user has also demonstrated the ability to provide custom tailoring for NIST controls, as well as auditing over multiple FISMA system boundaries.
dbea7cf4-b0fa-4443-a34d-8d0c0909eb10.name: Certified Q-Compliance End User

badge_template_activities.title: The End User Training is a half-day course that consists of training slides and several hands-on labs to be completed in an AWS environment. The class walks through building out baselines and assets, defining organizations and systems, configuring controls and creating executive dashboards, collecting and alerting on evidence and daily system priorities are all covered in depth.

Successful completion of all lab sections in Q-Compliance End User Course, demonstrating the following competencies: FISMA System Boundary Creation, Control Tailoring, Controls Assessment, Real-Time Evidence Gathering, System Authorization, System and Organization Scoring, Risk Scoring, Real-Time Alerting, and POAM Creation

09e9d61f-23e1-4823-a11a-9b01b6385ae0.description: This certification requires Q-Compliance End User as a prerequisite. After completing that certification, users must attend the Q-Compliance Deployment course and successfully complete all 8 labs, demonstrating an understanding of how to deploy, configure, and customize the Q-Compliance application.
09e9d61f-23e1-4823-a11a-9b01b6385ae0.name: Certified Q-Compliance Deployment

badge_template_activities.title: The Q-Compliance Deployment Training walks attendees through deploying, installing, and configuring the application. Over the course of two days attendees will master the creation of custom controls and visualizations, configuring, ingestion, and mapping data to any framework needed.

Successful completion of 8 labs, demonstrating competence in: Splunk Application installation and configuration, KV Store and Saved Searches, Data model mapping and normalization, NIST Control Mapping, Custom Vizualizations, Custom Controls, Custom Control Libraries, Pivot searching, Application Troubleshooting

0057d64f-e121-42af-bfea-fff14795c6cb.description: In order to earn this certification, a user must already have the Q-Audit Certified End User. After the prerequisite is completed, certification is achieved by attending the Q-Audit deployment course and successfully completing 7 labs that show an understanding of deploying and configuring the Q-Audit program.
0057d64f-e121-42af-bfea-fff14795c6cb.name: Certified Q-Audit Deployment

badge_template_activities.title: The Q-Audit Deployment Training is a one-day course that prepares students for installing and configuring the Q-Audit application in their organization. It explains the required data sources and corresponding data models to populate Q-Audit; how to configure and on-board the two primary data sources - Linux and Windows audit logs; how to install Q-Audit and supporting technical add-ons in Splunk; how to configure Q-Audit and verify that the installation is correct.
Successful completion of 7 labs, demonstrating competence in: Application Installation and Configuration, Data Normalization, Linux Auditing, Windows Auditing, and Splunk Saved Searches and Lookups

4576820e-bbbc-4c64-95cb-09de21e2eac8.description: This accreditation requires extensive Splunk and Qmulos Products training, plus successful completion of a practical project and passing an exam to show mastery of Qmulos Products. This level of mastery is required before someone can deliver and install Qmulos solutions for a customer.
4576820e-bbbc-4c64-95cb-09de21e2eac8.name: Accredited Qmulos Products Delivery

badge_template_activities.title: Capstone Project: the candidate has successfully configured a working Qmulos Products instance across multiple Windows and Linux servers, as graded and evaluated by a Senior Qmulos Consultant, Trainer, or Programmer.
Capstone Exam: the candidate has scored above 75% on a 3-hour exam covering features of all Qmulos apps.
